gospel.text:
[[Lc 7,11]]Jesus journeyed to a city called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd accompanied him.
[[Lc 7,12]]As he drew near to the gate of the city, a man who had died was being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. A large crowd from the city was with her.
[[Lc 7,13]]When the Lord saw her, he was moved with pity for her and said to her, "Do not weep."
[[Lc 7,14]]He stepped forward and touched the coffin; at this the bearers halted, and he said, "Young man, I tell you, arise!"
[[Lc 7,15]]The dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him to his mother.
[[Lc 7,16]]Fear seized them all, and they glorified God, exclaiming, "A great prophet has arisen in our midst," and "God has visited his people."
[[Lc 7,17]]This report about him spread through the whole of Judea and in all the surrounding region.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 101,1b]]Of mercy and judgment I will sing; 
to you, O LORD, I will sing praise.
[[Ps 101,2a]]I will persevere in the way of integrity;
[[Ps 101,2b]]when will you come to me?

[[Ps 101,2c]]I will walk with blameless heart,
[[Ps 101,2d]]within my house;
[[Ps 101,3a]]I will not set before my eyes
[[Ps 101,3b]]any base thing.

[[Ps 101,5]]Whoever slanders his neighbor in secret, 
him will I destroy. 
The man of haughty eyes and puffed up heart 
I will not endure.

[[Ps 101,6]]My eyes are upon the faithful of the land, 
that they may dwell with me. 
He who walks in the way of integrity 
shall be in my service.

first_reading.title: First Letter to Timothy
first_reading.text:
[[1_Tm 3,1]]Beloved, this saying is trustworthy: whoever aspires to the office of bishop desires a noble task.
[[1_Tm 3,2]]Therefore, a bishop must be irreproachable, married only once, temperate, self-controlled, decent, hospitable, able to teach,
[[1_Tm 3,3]]not a drunkard, not aggressive, but gentle, not contentious, not a lover of money.
[[1_Tm 3,4]]He must manage his own household well, keeping his children under control with perfect dignity;
[[1_Tm 3,5]]for if a man does not know how to manage his own household, how can he take care of the church of God?
[[1_Tm 3,6]]He should not be a recent convert, so that he may not become conceited and thus incur the devil's punishment.
[[1_Tm 3,7]]He must also have a good reputation among outsiders, so that he may not fall into disgrace, the devil's trap.
[[1_Tm 3,8]]Similarly, deacons must be dignified, not deceitful, not addicted to drink, not greedy for sordid gain,
[[1_Tm 3,9]]holding fast to the mystery of the faith with a clear conscience.
[[1_Tm 3,10]]Moreover, they should be tested first; then, if there is nothing against them, let them serve as deacons.
[[1_Tm 3,11]]Women, similarly, should be dignified, not slanderers, but temperate and faithful in everything.
[[1_Tm 3,12]]Deacons may be married only once and must manage their children and their households well.
[[1_Tm 3,13]]Thus those who serve well as deacons gain good standing and much confidence in their faith in Christ Jesus.
